page.title: 17THE DONKEY SANCTUARY
page.content: The first Sanctuary for distressed and mistreated donkeys opened at Ottery St Mary in 1969. In 1974 new premises at Sidmouth were purchased. The charity has since purchaed four further farms, including the one at Tedburn St Mary, and now cares for almost 2000 donkeys. 400 of these are at Tedburn. The sanctuary gives every donkey admitted the right of life, regardless of age or health, and the best possible treatment, care and drugs to preserve its life to the maximum. It provides peace, freedom and protection. Death is only induced in the event of extreme suffering. Some donkeys are rehabilitated to homes that can offer the best conditions. No donkey is ever sold. Once they have been admitted they have security for life. A most unusual charity.
